why.title: Why PixelSwift?
why.fastDesc: Supports 5 major image formats, processed instantly in milliseconds ‚Äî no upload or download wait.
why.secureDesc: Your files stay on your device. All processing happens locally in the browser ‚Äî nothing is sent to any server.
why.freeDesc: All features fully available ‚Äî no watermarks, unlimited use, no registration required.
why.batchDesc: Process up to 20 images at once, each up to 50MB ‚Äî handle large batches with ease.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: PixelSwift supports JPG, PNG, WebP, and BMP formats for conversion, compression, and resizing.
faq.q2: Are my images uploaded to a server?
faq.a2: No. All processing happens locally in your browser. Your images never leave your device.
faq.q3: Is there a file size limit?
faq.a3: Each file can be up to 50MB. You can process up to 20 images at once.

upload.orBrowse: or click to browse from your computer
upload.supportedFormats: Supports JPG, PNG, WEBP, BMP up to 50MB

converter.title: Universal Image Converter
converter.subtitle: Fast, clean, and secure online image processing. Convert between JPG, PNG, and WebP formats.
converter.uploadHint: Supports JPG, PNG, WEBP, BMP up to 50MB ¬∑ Batch upload available

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I convert PNG to JPG online?
faq.a1: Simply upload your PNG file, select JPG as the output format, then click Process. Your converted file will be ready to download instantly ‚Äî no server upload required.
faq.q2: What is the difference between WebP and JPG?
faq.a2: WebP is a modern format developed by Google that offers 25-35% smaller file sizes than JPG at comparable quality. It supports transparency (like PNG) and is ideal for web use. However, JPG has broader compatibility with older software.
faq.q3: Does converting image formats affect quality?
faq.a3: Converting between lossy formats (like JPG ‚Üî WebP) may slightly reduce quality. Converting to PNG is always lossless. PixelSwift uses optimized high-quality settings to preserve maximum visual fidelity during conversion.

compressor.title: Smart Image Compressor
compressor.subtitle: Reduce file size while maintaining quality. Perfect for PNG, JPG, and WEBP.
compressor.uploadHint: Supports JPG, PNG, WEBP up to 50MB ¬∑ Batch upload available
compressor.uploadHintSingle: Supports JPG, PNG, WEBP up to 50MB
compressor.proTipText: WebP format can reduce file size by an additional 30% compared to JPG without noticeable quality loss.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How to compress images without losing quality?
faq.a1: Use PixelSwift's quality slider set to 80-90% for near-lossless compression. At this level, the visual difference is imperceptible while file sizes can be reduced by 40-60%. You can use the side-by-side comparison to verify quality before downloading.
faq.q2: What is the difference between compressing PNG and JPG?
faq.a2: JPG compression removes visual data (lossy) ‚Äî lower quality means smaller files. PNG compression intelligently reduces the number of colors (similar to TinyPNG) ‚Äî significantly shrinking file size while keeping the visual result nearly identical. PixelSwift handles both automatically based on your input format.
faq.q3: How much can I reduce an image file size?
faq.a3: Typical results: JPG images can be reduced by 40-70%, PNG images by 20-50%. Results vary based on image content, color complexity, and your quality settings. For even greater size savings, try converting to WebP format using our Converter tool.

resizer.title: Precision Image Resizer
resizer.uploadHint: Supports JPG, PNG, WEBP, BMP up to 50MB
resizer.securityNote: Files are processed locally and are secure.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I resize an image to a specific size?
faq.a1: Upload your image, enter the exact width and height in pixels, or use percentage mode to scale proportionally. You can also use quick presets for common sizes like 1:1, 4:3, or 16:9. Click Resize & Download to get your resized image.
faq.q2: Does resizing an image reduce quality?
faq.a2: Reducing image dimensions slightly lowers quality since pixels are removed. However, PixelSwift uses high-quality bicubic interpolation to minimize quality loss. Enlarging images may cause blurriness as new pixels must be created.
faq.q3: What is the difference between scaling and cropping?
faq.a3: Scaling changes the overall dimensions of your entire image ‚Äî making it larger or smaller while keeping all content visible. Cropping cuts away parts of the image to focus on a specific area. PixelSwift's resizer uses scaling to preserve your complete image.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.overviewText: PixelSwift is an online image processing tool that runs entirely in your browser. We take your privacy seriously, and this policy explains how we handle your data.
privacy.dataText: PixelSwift does not collect, store, or transmit any of your image files or personal data related to your images. Specifically:
privacy.dataItem1: Your images are never uploaded to any server
privacy.dataItem2: All image processing is performed locally in your browser
privacy.dataItem3: We do not collect any personally identifiable information through our image tools
privacy.localText: All image conversion, compression, and resizing features of PixelSwift are executed entirely within your browser. Your files never leave your device, meaning you have complete control over your data.
privacy.cookiesText: PixelSwift uses essential functional cookies to save your language preference and theme settings. We also use cookies set by Google Analytics for website usage analysis (see Analytics section below).
privacy.analyticsText: We use Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to understand how visitors use our website. This helps us improve user experience. Google Analytics may collect:
privacy.analyticsItem1: Pages visited and time spent on each page
privacy.analyticsItem2: Browser type, device type, and operating system
privacy.analyticsItem3: General geographic location (country/city level, not precise location)
privacy.analyticsItem4: Referral sources (how you found our website)
privacy.thirdPartyText: PixelSwift uses Google Analytics 4 for website usage analysis. Google may process this data according to their own privacy policy. We do not use any advertising services, and we do not sell or share your data with any other third parties.
privacy.rightsText: You can opt out of Google Analytics tracking by using browser extensions such as Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on, or by adjusting your browser's cookie settings. Disabling analytics cookies will not affect the functionality of PixelSwift.
privacy.contactText: If you have any questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at:

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.acceptText: By using PixelSwift, you agree to these terms of use. If you do not agree with these terms, please stop using the service.
terms.serviceText: PixelSwift provides free online image processing tools, including format conversion, image compression, and resizing. All processing is performed locally in your browser without requiring registration or login.
terms.usageItem1: You may use PixelSwift for personal or commercial purposes
terms.usageItem2: Do not use this tool to process illegal content
terms.usageItem3: Do not attempt to interfere with or disrupt the normal operation of this service
terms.ipText: The PixelSwift brand name, logo, and interface design are protected by intellectual property rights. Images you process through this tool remain yours, and we claim no rights over them.
terms.disclaimerText: PixelSwift is provided "as is" without any express or implied warranties. While we strive to ensure the reliability and accuracy of our tools, we are not responsible for any data loss or damage resulting from the use of this tool. We recommend keeping original backups before processing important images.
terms.changesText: We reserve the right to modify these terms of use at any time. Any changes will take effect immediately upon being posted on this page. Continued use of PixelSwift constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.
terms.contactText: If you have any questions about these terms of use, please contact us at:

contact.desc: If you have any questions, suggestions, or feedback, feel free to reach out to us.
